maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves a certificate associated with the SMB server for SMB over QUIC.

The Get-SmbServerCertificateMapping cmdlet retrieves the certificates associated with the SMB server for SMB over QUIC on ‘Windows Server 2022 Datacenter: Azure Edition’. This cmdlet is not used for Windows or other Windows Server editions. For more information, review SMB over QUIC (https://aka.ms/smboverquic).
Specifies a fully-qualified DNS name or NetBIOS name that must match the certificate’s subject name or an entry in the certificate’s subject alternative names.
Specifies the subject name of the certificate.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a `New-CimSession` (/powershell/module/cimcmdlets/new-cimsession) or [`Get-CimSession`](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies a friendly name to display for the mapping.
Specifies if `NamedPipes` are enabled for SMB over QUIC. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- `None:` Remove all flags
- `AllowNamedPipe:` Enable use of named pipes in SMB over QUIC connections for this mapping (off by default, overrides value of RestrictNamedPipeAccessOverQuic)
- `DefaultCert:` Not used
Not used.
Specifies the path to the certificate store for the certificate.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of 0 is entered, then Windows PowerShell calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies the thumbprint value of the certificate.
Specifies the type of certificate mapping. The acceptable value for this parameter is: `QUIC:` Certificate mapping is for SMB over QUIC.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a `New-CimSession` (/powershell/module/cimcmdlets/new-cimsession) or [`Get-CimSession`](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies a friendly name to display for the mapping.
Specifies if `NamedPipes` are enabled for SMB over QUIC. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- `None:` Remove all flags
- `AllowNamedPipe:` Enable use of named pipes in SMB over QUIC connections for this mapping (off by default, overrides value of RestrictNamedPipeAccessOverQuic)
- `DefaultCert:` Not used
Not used.
Specifies a fully-qualified DNS name or NetBIOS name that must match the certificate’s subject name or an entry in the certificate’s subject alternative names.
Specifies the path to the certificate store for the certificate.
Specifies the subject name of the certificate.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of 0 is entered, then Windows PowerShell calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies the thumbprint value of the certificate.
Specifies the type of certificate mapping. The acceptable value for this parameter is: `QUIC:` Certificate mapping is for SMB over QUIC.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 - Retrieve the certificate mapped to two SMB over QUIC server names
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-SmbServerCertificateMapping
Name Subject Thumbprint DisplayName StoreName Type Flags ---- ------- ---------- ----------- --------- ---- ----- 2022-ae-02.corp.contoso.com CN=2022-ae-02 88032B3551FAF7DE26EFFFF814AA086E3DBD2A4F 2022-ae-02 My QUIC None fs2.contoso.com CN=2022-ae-02 88032B3551FAF7DE26EFFFF814AA086E3DBD2A4F 2022-ae-02 My QUIC None

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a certificate association with the SMB server for SMB over QUIC.

The New-SmbServerCertificateMapping cmdlet associates a certificate to the SMB server for SMB over QUIC on Windows Server 2022 Datacenter: Azure Edition. This cmdlet is not used for Windows or other Windows Server editions. For more information, review SMB over QUIC (https://aka.ms/smboverquic).
Specifies a fully-qualified DNS name or NetBIOS name that must match the certificate’s subject name or an entry in the certificate’s subject alternative names.
Specifies the thumbprint value of the certificate.
Specifies the path to the certificate store for the certificate. The recommended value is “My” for the local machine personal store.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (/powershell/module/cimcmdlets/new-cimsession) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies a friendly name to display for the mapping.
Specifies if Named Pipes are enabled for SMB over QUIC. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- `None:` Remove all flags.
- `AllowNamedPipe:` Enable use of named pipes in SMB over QUIC connections for this mapping (off by default, overrides the value of RestrictNamedPipeAccessOverQuic).
- `DefaultCert:` Not used.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the subject name of the certificate.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of 0 is entered, then Windows PowerShell calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies the type of certificate mapping. The acceptable value for this parameter is: `QUIC` Certificate mapping is for SMB over QUIC.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (/powershell/module/cimcmdlets/new-cimsession) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies a friendly name to display for the mapping.
Specifies if Named Pipes are enabled for SMB over QUIC. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- `None:` Remove all flags.
- `AllowNamedPipe:` Enable use of named pipes in SMB over QUIC connections for this mapping (off by default, overrides the value of RestrictNamedPipeAccessOverQuic).
- `DefaultCert:` Not used.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies a fully-qualified DNS name or NetBIOS name that must match the certificate’s subject name or an entry in the certificate’s subject alternative names.
Specifies the path to the certificate store for the certificate. The recommended value is “My” for the local machine personal store.
Specifies the subject name of the certificate.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of 0 is entered, then Windows PowerShell calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies the thumbprint value of the certificate.
Specifies the type of certificate mapping. The acceptable value for this parameter is: `QUIC` Certificate mapping is for SMB over QUIC.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 - Map a certificate located in the local machine's personal store
command:example.dev:code:
New-SmbServerCertificateMapping -Name fs2.contoso.com -Thumbprint 88032B3551FAF7DE26EFFFF814AA086E3DBD2A4F -StoreName my -Subject CN=2022-ae-02
Name Subject Thumbprint DisplayName StoreName Type Flags ---- ------- ---------- ----------- --------- ---- ----- fs2.contoso.com CN=2022-ae-02 88032B3551FAF7DE26EFFFF814AA086E3DBD2A4F 2022-ae-02 my QUIC None

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a certificate mapping from the SMB server for SMB over QUIC.

The Remove-SmbServerCertificateMapping cmdlet removes a certificate’s mapping to the SMB server for SMB over QUIC on ‘Windows Server 2022 Datacenter: Azure Edition’. This cmdlet is not used for Windows or other Windows Server editions. For more information, review SMB over QUIC.
Specifies a fully-qualified DNS name or NetBIOS name that must match the certificate’s subject name or an entry in the certificate’s subject alternative names.
Specifies the subject name of the certificate.
Specifies the thumbprint value of the certificate.
Specifies a friendly name to display for the mapping.
Specifies the path to the certificate store for the certificate. The recommended value is “My” for the local machine personal store.
`QUIC` Certificate mapping is for SMB over QUIC.
Specifies if Named Pipes are enabled for SMB over QUIC. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- `None:` Remove all flags.
- `AllowNamedPipe:` Enable use of named pipes in SMB over QUIC connections for this mapping (off by default, overrides the value of RestrictNamedPipeAccessOverQuic).
- `DefaultCert:` Not used.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a `New-CimSession` (/powershell/module/cimcmdlets/new-cimsession) or [`Get-CimSession`](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Not used.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of 0 is entered, then Windows PowerShell calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

The default is the current session on the local computer.

The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies a friendly name to display for the mapping.
Specifies if Named Pipes are enabled for SMB over QUIC. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- `None:` Remove all flags.
- `AllowNamedPipe:` Enable use of named pipes in SMB over QUIC connections for this mapping (off by default, overrides the value of RestrictNamedPipeAccessOverQuic).
- `DefaultCert:` Not used.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Not used.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies a fully-qualified DNS name or NetBIOS name that must match the certificate’s subject name or an entry in the certificate’s subject alternative names.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 - Remove a certificate mapping for SMB server edge endpoint
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-SmbServerCertificateMapping
Name Subject Thumbprint DisplayName StoreName Type Flags ---- ------- ---------- ----------- --------- ---- ----- 2022-ae-02.corp.contoso.com CN=2022-ae-02 88032B3551FAF7DE26EFFFF814AA086E3DBD2A4F 2022-ae-02 my QUIC None fs2.contoso.com CN=2022-ae-02 88032B3551FAF7DE26EFFFF814AA086E3DBD2A4F 2022-ae-02 my QUIC None
Remove-SmbServerCertificateMapping -Name fs2.contoso.com -Thumbprint 88032B3551FAF7DE26EFFFF814AA086E3DBD2A4F
Confirm Are you sure you want to perform this action? Performing operation 'Delete' on Target 'SMB Server Certificate Mapping.'. [Y] Yes [A] Yes to All [N] No [L] No to All [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"): y

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes a certificate mapping for SMB server edge endpoint “fs2.contoso.com” with a specific certificate thumbprint.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies a certificate association with the SMB server for SMB over QUIC.

The Set-SmbServerCertificateMapping cmdlet modifies a certificate’s association to the SMB server for SMB over QUIC on Windows Server 2022 Datacenter: Azure Edition. This cmdlet is not used for Windows or other Windows Server editions. For more information, review SMB over QUIC (https://aka.ms/smboverquic).
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (/powershell/module/cimcmdlets/new-cimsession) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies if Named Pipes are enabled for SMB over QUIC. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- `None:` Remove all flags.
- `AllowNamedPipe:` Enable use of named pipes in SMB over QUIC connections for this mapping (off by default, overrides the value of RestrictNamedPipeAccessOverQuic).
- `DefaultCert:` Not used.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies the path to the certificate store for the certificate. The recommended value is “My” for the local machine personal store.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of 0 is entered, then Windows PowerShell calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies the thumbprint value of the certificate.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1 - Enable Named Pipes for the SMB over QUIC endpoint
